meanings.definition: Living or growing on land but requiring a moist environment.
meanings.sent1: The frog is a semiterrestrial creature, needing both land and water to survive.
meanings.sent2: The semiterrestrial plants in the garden thrive in damp soil.
meanings.sent3: The semiterrestrial snail decided to take a stroll in the rain for some extra moisture.
meanings.sent4: The semiterrestrial turtle ventured out of the pond, exploring the damp earth.
meanings.sent5: The semiterrestrial crab scuttled along the muddy shore, enjoying the wet sand.

meanings.definition: An organism that spends part of its life cycle on land and part in water.
meanings.sent1: The newt is a semiterrestrial, starting its life in water and later moving to land.
meanings.sent2: The semiterrestrial frog lays its eggs in water but lives on land as an adult.
meanings.sent3: The semiterrestrial duckling had a dilemma deciding between swimming in the pond or waddling on the grass.
meanings.sent4: The semiterrestrial tadpole transformed into a frog, embracing its dual habitat lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The semiterrestrial salamander gracefully transitioned from the stream to the forest floor.
